grounding: This review summarizes the current status of development in photoluminescent probes, multidimensional photoluminescence detection, and multivariate data analysis methods. It then highlights reports featuring multivariate analysis of multidimensional measurements of photoluminescent probes published between June 2015 and June 2022, emphasizing work in the last 5 years. Important trends include the development of probe arrays, which provide fingerprint responses to the analyte(s) of interest and facilitate the analysis of complex samples; the application of neural networks and deep learning to pattern recognition and feature selection in photoluminescence images; and the application of multiway multivariate analysis to mining matrices, three-way arrays, and higher-order measurements, including hyperspectral intensity and lifetime images. These examples illustrate the increase in information extraction provided by the combination of multidimensional measurements and multivariate analysis.
generated_text: The integration of photoluminescent probes with data-enabled sensing technologies is revolutionizing the field of analytical chemistry. This study explores the application of multidimensional fluorescence and phosphorescence techniques in conjunction with advanced multivariate and N-way analysis methods. By leveraging these sophisticated analytical tools, researchers can extract comprehensive information from complex datasets, enhancing the sensitivity and specificity of luminescent probes. Image analysis further augments this capability, allowing for spatially resolved detection and quantification of analytes. The synergy between photoluminescent probes and data-driven approaches offers unprecedented opportunities for real-time, high-throughput sensing applications across various scientific disciplines. This paper highlights recent advancements and potential future directions in the development of these innovative sensing platforms, emphasizing their role in addressing contemporary analytical challenges.
